title.narrative: EU Support to Progressive Platforms for Climate Action

description.narrative: GGGI seeks to collaborate with UNDP in advancing policy preparedness for countries as they embark on implementing their NDCs within the context of their National Development Plans. Within their NDCs, these countries outlined their climate change vulnerabilities; adaptation and mitigation targets; and the international support is needed to achieve these targets.

The overall objectives of the proposed Action are to:
- Promote implementation of the Paris Agreement and the transition to low carbon and climate resilient economies. Through research and experience sharing, enhance understanding and readiness for the implementation of the Paris Agreement while discussing implementation challenges such as establishing governance arrangements, attracting finance, long term planning, tracking NDC progress, among others.
- Support countries in building the capacity to engage in the UNFCCC negotiations. The Action will support countries develop plan, list of agreed priorities, and engagement strategy for the UNFCCC negotiations both at the technical and Ministerial level.
This Action is expected to contribute to the following results:
-Mobilise political leadership, foster progressive thinking and discussion among countries.
-Contribute to countries successful implementation of the Paris Agreement and its objectives.
-Support the identification of priorities and the development of engagement strategies in preparation for the UNFCCC negotiations.
-Promote a stronger coordination among the members of the selected groups in preparation for the UNFCCC negotiations.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04518 Republic of Korea

title.narrative:
Output 1: Strengthening countries’ capacities towards implementation of the Paris Agreement and the transition to low carbon and climate resilient economies
1.1 - Capacity development training module and brief guideline developed - Module dissemination website developed
1.2 NDC mainstreaming and implementation guideline developed

description.narrative:
1.1 Training modules published in dedicated website
1.2 Publishing of guideline online

title.narrative: Modules completed and online in GGGI website
Report published and online in GGGI website

Output 2: Least Developed Countries supported in building the capacity to engage in the UNFCCC process
2.1 - Summary reports to the LDC Chair and team on missions undertaken / meetings attended on behalf of the LDC Group, e.g. with the UK Presidency Team [internal] - Oral briefings to the LDC Chair and LDC Group representatives on ‘crunch issues’ in the negotiations during strategy preparatory meetings and the UNFCCC sessions - Advisory and technical support for the convening of meetings during UNFCCC sessions (e.g. agenda setting) with progressive allies
2.2 - Advisory and technical support for the convening of non-UNFCCC meetings (e.g. agenda setting) with progressive allies - Represent the LDC Chair / Group, on demand, at side events and workshops in relation to in-country climate action and Paris implementation

description.narrative:
2.1 - Schedule and agenda of UNFCCC shared/published in UNFCCC website - Status reports of negotiations in the UNFCCC process
2.2 Schedule & agenda of different organizations like OECD, groups other than LDC

title.narrative: Advisory and coordination support provided across issues
Better representation of LDCs voices in the UNFCCC negotiations as well progressing implementation of the Paris Agreement

description.narrative: NDC guideline and the mainstreaming capacity building module is published

title.narrative: LDCs engaegement in the UNFCCC process
Enhanced NDC implementation in SIDS and LDCs
Report and modules developed and published online in GGGI website
LDCs and progressive platforms increase their engagement in the UNFCCC negotiations, including on the remaining elements of the Paris Agreement rulebook

description.narrative: The LDC’s position well represented in the outcomes of COP26

title.narrative: LDCs engaegement in the UNFCCC process
Global knowledge sharing, capacity development and policy dialogue to advance green growth in LDCs and SIDS
